Class: MCT

MCT()

new MCT()

The Open MCT application. This may be configured by installing plugins or registering extensions before the application is started.

Source:
  • MCT.js, line 87

Extends

  • EventEmitter

Members

composition :module:openmct.CompositionAPI

An interface for interacting with the composition of domain objects. The composition of a domain object is the list of other domain objects it "contains" (for instance, that should be displayed beneath it in the tree.)

composition may be called as a function, in which case it acts as composition.get.

Type:
  • module:openmct.CompositionAPI
Source:
  • MCT.js, line 136

conductor :module:openmct.TimeConductor

MCT's time conductor, which may be used to synchronize view contents for telemetry- or time-based views.

Type:
  • module:openmct.TimeConductor

inspectorViews :module:openmct.InspectorViewRegistry

Registry for views which should appear in the Inspector area. These views will be chosen based on the selection state.

Registry for views which should appear in Edit Properties dialogs, and similar user interface elements used for modifying domain objects external to its regular views.

toolbars :module:openmct.ToolbarRegistry

Registry for views which should appear in the toolbar area while editing. These views will be chosen based on the selection state.

Methods

getAssetPath()

Get path to where assets are hosted.

Source:
  • MCT.js, line 334

setAssetPath()

Set path to where assets are hosted. This should be the path to main.js.

Source:
  • MCT.js, line 325

start(domElementopt)

Start running Open MCT. This should be called only after any plugins have been installed.

Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
domElement HTMLElement <optional>

the DOM element in which to run MCT; if undefined, MCT will be run in the body of the document
Source:
  • MCT.js, line 352
Fires:
  • module:openmct.MCT~event:start

Events

start

Fired by MCT when the application is started.

Source:
